content:
Hello!
It’s HL7 FHIR Connectathon Planning time! We hope to see you all in Montreal on May 4 & 5. I wanted to let you know that the Connectathon Wiki has been replaced! WHAT?! That’s right. We are moving Connectathon communication from the wiki to the HL7 Confluence site so be sure to bookmark the Connectathons page under FHIR > Implementers and then watch it for updates. If you don’t have access to confluence yet go to https://confluence.hl7.org/ to request access.
Please enter your track proposal into CONFLUENCE no later than March 21st, 2019. That’s only one week away!
Questions? Just ask!
Sandy Vance
HL7 FHIR Connectathon Administrator
Sandy.vance@aegis.net
614.273.5916
It took me a bit to find this, so in case it helps anyone else, here's a link to that page: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Connectathons
And note that the conman link has not been updated - still points to san antonio. Will fix in the next couple of days...
@Grahame Grieve - will you be creating a FHIR 4.2.0 version for connectathon 21?

I hadn't thought to do so. We usually stick to the most recent released version until we start getting into the development cycle for the next version - so I would expect the Montreal connectathon and the one after that to be R4 focused
Ok, just checking. Thanks.
More specifically - if anyone has a desperate need to have their connectathon track for May or Sept. making use of any of the FHIR R5 draft changes, they need to holler.
Anything further on ConMan for C21, @David Hay?
@Sandra Vance are those times on the Confluence Site correct? In particular, are we finishing at 5pm on Saturday and 10pm on Sunday?

Yep. here it is: http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=montreal2019
(note it's on a different server - but otherwise the same...)

Did you want me to copy your track from SA across?

heres the confluence page: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Connectathons
good catch @Peter Jordan - I've updated...
copy what track, @David Hay?
Ah - terminology... :)
@David Hay Please copy the Terminology Track from SA (not sure about the others that @Rob Hausam leads/participates in).

@David Hay It should have been rather obvious, but I finally get it - you meant copy it in ConMan. I had already created the track proposals, which somehow is what I was thinking. Of course, please do copy the tracks in ConMan for Terminology Services, and also what you have for IPS and LIVD (if you haven't already). Thanks, @Peter Jordan.
@David Hay , yes, please copy the Clinical Reasoning track from SA, thank you :)
done...
For anyone working on bulk data + analytics, we'll be using #bulk data for discussion during the next couple of days :)
New track this time: testing trusted dynamic client registration & related topics. We are chatting in the #Cross Org App Reg stream this weekend. Breakout at 11am in Salon 1.

For anyone interested in Care Planning process, including Clinical Practice Guidelines on FHIR (CPG-on-FHIR), follow our activity here: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179207-connectathon-mgmt/topic/Care.20Planning.20and.20Management

Breakout track beginning in Salon 1 now (just below connectathon room) on dynamic client registration
Hope you can join us!
SGA: For those of you hunting caffeine, the bar downstairs serves Starbucks.
But what if we want coffee?

Hey everyone,
If you want help with the use or support of the HSPC Sandbox, PM me with your name and table and I'd love to help out. We've recently implemented some new features which includes CDS Hook management and demoing, profile (i.e. us-core, QI-core, etc.) uploading and validation, and SMART on FHIR 1.0 support.
Thanks!
